player.name: Matt Le Tissier
player.description: Le Tissier spent his entire professional Club career with Southampton and even scored the final goal at the Club’s old ground, The Dell. His loyalty garnering special affection from Southampton's fans who nicknamed him "Le God". He was voted PFA Young Player of the Year for the 1989/90 season, in which he was one of the league's top goal scorers with 20 goals. An attacking midfielder with exceptional technical skills, Le Tissier was the first midfielder to score 100 goals in the Barclays Premier League. Throughout his career, Le Tissier had a fearsome reputation for scoring from the spot, converting 47 of the 48 penalties that he took for Southampton.

data.key: 2 Premier League Player of the Month awards

player.name: Rickie Lambert
player.description: Lambert proved a key signing for Southampton with a transfer fee from Bristol Rovers of approximately £1 million, he quickly became their top scorer as they were promoted to the Championship in 2010 and to the Barclays Premier League the following season. He scored on his first ever Barclays Premier League appearance, scoring just minutes after replacing Jay Rodriguez as a substitute against Manchester City. This goal meant that Lambert joined a select group of players who have scored in all 4 league divisions.

player.name: Maya Yoshida
player.description: On 30th August 2012, Maya agreed to join Southampton on a three-year contract for a fee thought to be in the region of £3 million. He made his debut on the 15th September 2012, against Arsenal, coming on as a 28th minute substitute for Jos Hooiveld. Maya then made his home debut in a 4–1 win over Aston Villa, playing the whole 90 minutes.

data.key: Captained Japan at the London 2012 Olympic Games

player.name: James Beattie
player.description: Beattie joined Southampton from Blackburn Rovers in July 1998, valued at £1 million. In the 2002/03 season, Beattie scored 23 goals, making him the third-highest Barclays Premier League goalscorer (and the highest English goalscorer) for that season. His fine form helped Southampton reach the 2003 FA Cup final, their first since victory in 1976.

data.key: Highest scoring English Player in the Barclays Premier League

player.name: Claus Lundekvam
player.description: Graeme Souness spent £400,000 on signing Claus Lundekvam from Brann in his native Norway and the 6’3” defender went on to become a rock in the heart of the Southampton defence. Claus played a huge part in one of the Club’s best ever seasons, captaining the side as they finished 8th in the Barclays Premier League before leading the Saints out at the 2003 FA Cup final. Lundekvam was capped 40 times for his national side, his first international goal was the 1,000th goal in the history of the Norwegian national team.
